title: The roman galleries - Mining Museum
textContent: Underneath the Orlea mountain you will discover a part of the antic galleries built by romans to extract the gold. Under all over the viliage there are over 120km of such roman galleries, but their precise length is not known because the gallery network hasn't been fully researched until now. Wherever you are in Rosia Montana you are above of some such galleries, they are being disposed even on multiple floors. There are guided tours to access the galleries. Each tour last about an hour and they are opened from Monday to Friday 8:00-14:00. They can be visit outside these working hours by making an early reservation (Contact Rus Valentin: (+4)0744346748)

images.title: The roman galleries
images.description: To reach them you have to go 157 stairs underground.

images.title: Stamp mills
images.description: Visit also the others exhibitions from the museum like this installation used to process the gold or the funerary monuments.

title: The Greek-Catholic Church
textContent: 'The Greek-Catholic Church is built on a hill from the Orlea mountain. Next to the church you will find the monument of Simion Balint which had an important role in the Revolt from 1848. For his activity he received a medal from Franz Joseph, The Emperor of Austria

images.title: The tower of the Catholic Church
images.description: 'The church is one of the most important religious monuments in the Apuseni Mountains, for his architecture and history.'

images.title: The Greek-Catholic Church
images.description: In the cemetery around the church you will find many tombstones dating from the eighteenth and nineteenth centuries, precious as historical evidences and as artistic achievements

title: The Panoramic Bench(Berg)
textContent: The Panoramic Bench is definitely the most romantic spot in Roșia Montană. It’s 10 minutes away from Casa Petri, and we recommend to visit it at night as well, to enjoy the sky full of stars and the quiet of the village. On your way to the bench you will pass through the old German neighborhood ‘Berg’.

images.title: The German School & Francisc House
images.description: heritage buildings in ‘Berg’ neighborhood

images.title: The Panoramic Bench
images.description: view towards the Cârnic Mountains, that holds over 150 km of roman galleries, unique in the world

title: The Roman-Catholic Church
textContent: Being built on higher ground makes the Clock tower visible from all over the historic center and the bells to be heard from any home. From our grandparents we’ve heard that the tomb in front of the church is the resting place of the man who financed the church’s construction, with one condition: that the church's place and his tomb not to be moved. It is said that while he searched for gold in the galleries, he met with “Vâlva” (a ghost from a local legend) and made a pact with her regarding the church. We’re not saying more about this :) ... come to Rosia and ask about this story.

images.title: The Roman-Catholic Church
images.description: The Mass is held on Sunday at 10:00. At the end of the mass the pipe organ is played.

images.title: The Roman-Catholic Church
images.description: At Easter, the villagers bring a basket with food to be holly. The tomb of the Saviour is guarded all day by 7 guards that free the entrance during the Resurrection.

title: The Unitarian Church(1568)
textContent: ''Set on a small hilltop in the central area, the building dominates the central square and shines on all the spatial organization of the entire area, emerging as a valuable element of the urban structure.' The camps for restoration of the village’s heritage monuments are held annually.'

images.title: The Unitarian Church
images.description: The Mass is held on Sunday at 11:00. Stay after the Mass and talk with the priest who is happy to make a tour of the church or to show how the pipe organ works

images.title: The Unitarian Church
images.description: The priest supports the touristic development of the area, that’s why he allows the organization of cultural events here. Make sure you check if there are any events held here during your visit.

title: The Gallery and Jig-Văidoaia Peak
textContent: This gallery is different from that of the Mining Museum and seems more like a cave. But traces of excavations on the site of gold veins on its walls will convince you that has been created by our ancestors in search of gold. Climb to the top of the mountain and enjoy the view towards Tăul Brazi, Cârnic and the whole valley of Roșia Montană. Warning: you have to climb on the rocks!

images.title: Văidoaia Gallery
images.description: This is the “heart” of Roșia Montană. Seeing the rocks surrounding the gallery, you will understand where the name of the village comes from.

images.title: Jig-Văidoaia Peak
images.description: view towards the historical center and Carnic mountain.

title: 'Sicilian' Street
textContent: The 'Sicilian' Street from Roșia Montană is a historical street. It's almost like an open museum. It is a narrow street which starts from the main market and continues with tight bends around the old huge houses, like a tunnel. A medieval street, like those in old Italian cities, Baroque houses, with thick walls and one floor. Beautiful buildings, despite their decrepitude, where once lived the great goldsmiths of Rosia, the real masters of the treasures from the Apuseni Mountains.'

images.title: The Unitarian Parish House and Hungarian School
images.description: The Unitarian Parish House it is restored by ARA camps which takes place here each summer with students and teachers from the Architecture Faculty of Bucharest.

images.title: Calvin Church and the goldsmiths houses
images.description: this is the style of the heritage houses, white, simple, thick walls and small windows.

title: The Szekely house
textContent: The Szekely Acoș house, at the foot of Jig-Văidoaia mountain, is like a small fortress surrounded by a stone wall with a high vaulted gate. Perhaps these stone elements inspired Dan Pița in 1972 to make here the movie 'Stone Wedding'. When returning from the trail you can watch the movie at Casa Petri as it will have a greater impact once you know the area. Some of the filming crew were accommodated here, where you can find a picture with their autograph.
moreDetailsText: The film was nominated for TIFF in the top 10 Romanian films of all time. See here...

images.title: The Szekely house
images.description: the gate and Vlădoaia mountain.

images.title: Historical center - image from the ‘Stone Wedding' film
images.description: There were boutiques with various goodies, clothing, slippers repair workshops, tailors ..

title: Brazi Lake
textContent: The lakes in Roșia are man-made lakes used to operate the mills stamps. Stamps are displayed at the Mining Museum where you can see how gold was produced. Brazi Lake has a recreation area with benches, boats and specialized spaces for barbecues.

images.title: Brazi Lake
images.description: The house from the end of the lake belongs to a painter who moved here to use the view as inspiration for his works.

images.title: Brazi Lake - early morning
images.description: from here you can climb to Anghel Lake(the Lake without) which is about 10 minutes away..

title: Carnic Plateau
textContent: This is a small terrace that offers a spectacular view of the Old Town, 'Jig-Vaidoaia' peak and 'Tarina' land. From here you can see the most beautiful sunset from these lands..

images.title: Carnic Plateau
images.description: the view to the 'Vaidoaia' peak and 'Rotundu' peak where you can see the weather station.

images.title: Carnic Plateau
images.description: the view to the historical center

title: Cârnic Sphinx
textContent: The road will take you through a fir forest where you can find mushrooms, raspberries, blackberries and wild strawberries. When you will reach the Sphinx, you're at one of the highest points in Roșia Montană. Ahead you can see the historic center and behind the Cetate open pit.. It's called 'Cetate’ (Fortress) because here was indeed a fortress carved into the mountains by Dacians and Romans. But in communist era it was decided it's more important to destroy it and to have here an open mining area.

images.title: Cârnic Sphinx
images.description: The cross on the Sphinx was put here the miners to be guided in the mines in search of gold.

images.title: Overlooking - 'Cetate' open pit
images.description: That what remains after an open pit mining. Take a 360 degrees spin around and imagine that if a new gold exploitation would be open here(as the one proposed in 2014), the whole area would look like that.

title: Raven’s stone
textContent: From the Sphinx turn towards the mountaintop, the way you came on, till the end of the trail. We are  on the Raven’s Stone -  a natural protected reservations. From here you can see Corna Lake and village.

images.title: The Raven stone
images.description: the name comes from its raven’s head shape

images.title: The landscape from the Raven stone - 'Corna' valley
images.description: the entire surface of this depression would be transformed in the largest cyanide lake in Europe, if a new gold exploitation would be open here(as the one proposed in 2014)

title: Limestone sculptures
textContent: 'International Association for Sculpture organized here the first International Symposium of Monumental Sculpture in Romania. Three Romanian artists and six artists from Argentina, Canada, Egypt, France, the Netherlands and Japan have assembled a team that represented all continents and worked for a month in a spirit of friendship and artistic emulation.' The sculptures were donated to the heritage of Rosia Montana with the condition that they should not to be moved elsewhere'

images.title: Limestone sculptures
images.description: Their settlement in a farm yard was not randomly chosen. Orlea area is rich in groundwater resources and once the sculptures have become heritage monuments, the area became protected, and opening a open pit here ... is theoretically impossible.

images.title: 'DOOR' Sculpture
images.description: Ehab ELLABAN | Egipt | Zamalek Arts Academy, Cairo | Sculpture of Vistea limestone

title: 'Țarina' Pond
textContent: Here is a small piece of heaven pretty close to the Casa Petri. A well hidden lake behind some tall willow which bathe their branches in the pond. 'Tarina' land is the place where the villagers have farms, so the land is divided into small portions and here and there you can see haystacks or barns. Each year in these places is hold the FânFest festival which fill these places with peoples who come to stay in a tent.
moreDetailsText: More details about the festival here...

images.title: 'Țarina' Pond
images.description: A small mountain pond with great colors during autumn. Take some pictures on the bridge from the lake.

images.title: 'Țarina' lands
images.description: Endless hills with many haystacks which are handy when you want to rest s little from your trip.

title: The Weather Station
textContent: To reach the Weather Station you have to climb a little through a pine forest. Once you get there you are on the 'Rotundu' Peak(1240m). The weather station is used by the airplanes to transmit the weather states.

images.title: The Weather Station
images.description: If you want you can ring at the weather station door and ask to for a tour of the station ... the employees are pretty friendly.

images.title: The 'Rotundu' Peak(1240m) - the view to 'Apuseni' mountains
images.description: Enjoy the view. You can see from here, somewhere in the back, the 'Vulcan' Peak, the 'Găina' Peak and 'Bihor' Peak(the highest from Apuseni mountains(1849m))

title: Copper open pit - Roșia Poieni
textContent: You will see here the consequences of one of the biggest open pit from Europe upon the environment: a mountain was destroyed, dry soil, and the waste resulted from the mining process was stored downstream over the 'Geamana' village. At the entrance of the open pit is a checkpoint where you will have to show your id's and there might be some restrictions.
moreDetailsText: Maia Morgenstern made a video here to raise awareness for the open pit mining. You can see it here...

images.title: Roșia Poieni Open Pit
images.description: the open pit has 68 stairs, each of them has 15m high.

images.title: Roșia Poieni Open Pit
images.description: this was one of the prides of Romania during communism.

title: The Big Lake ('Tăul Mare')
textContent: As you can see by his name this lake is one of the biggest man made lakes from the area and is one of the quiet and relaxing areas from here. The lake was once used by the stamp mills to break the golden ore using the force of the water. That's why each lake has a little house in the middle of them. From this houses the water from the lakes can be release towards the stamp mills.

images.title: The Big Lake ('Tăul Mare')
images.description: has 2 small decks because it is used now for fishing. These are perfect to have a break and contemplate or make a selfie :)

images.title: The Big Lake ('Tăul Mare')
images.description: if you will climb a little on the hill you will see that the lake has a shape of a heart that's why he is also called 'The Heart Lake'.

title: Lety and Sulei peaks
textContent: The Lety and Sulei peaks are quite close to each other. From the distance they have the shape of a saddle, one is round and the other is sharp.

images.title: Sulei peak
images.description: the ridge is long and sharp and gives you the feeling that you are going on a rope and you have to keep balance.

images.title: The view from the Șulei peak
images.description: from here you can see the 'Cârnic' peak, the 'Anghel' lake and all the Roșia Montana valley.

title: 'Corna' pond
textContent: A small lake in the shadow of the 'Carnic' mountain, under the Raven Stone. Right next to it is the 'Corna' village.

images.title: 'Corna' pond
images.description: is an amazing view from here, perfect for a picnic (but leave the nature clean)

images.title: The 'Corna' village
images.description: Dacă doriți să explorați zona puteți coborâ până în sat pentru a vizita cele 2 biserici aflate pe culmile satului.
If you want to explore the area you can go down in the village to see the life of peoples from here which is quite different than the cities. Visit the two churches from the the village

title: Detunata
textContent: 'Detunata' is a protected area, and it looks like a huge wall made of rectangular columns of basalt. The wall is 100m high and at the base of it can be seen a mantle of detritus with huge rectangular rocks that are the remains of some columns that collapsed from the wall. The name 'Detunata' (blast) comes from the deafening sound that the collapsing rocks made, but now it's quiet and some of the rocks are covered with moss which makes an unique landscape. Explore the area! Here lived 'Fefeleaga'- The main character in the work of 'Ion Agârbiceanu'. Search the 'Fefeleaga' memorial house, listen to the people's stories and taste the cheese cakes from there.

images.title: Detunata
images.description: Between the rocks which collapsed from the wall, in the pine forest, sometimes, during spring and early summer a small glacier appears.

images.title: The landscape from the top of Detunata
images.description: Once you reach the peak you can see one of the most spectacular views of the entire 'Motilor' land - 'Apuseni' Mountains.

title: The 'Muntari' village
textContent: The road will lead you through the 'Muntari' and 'Poiana' villages, 2 places where the time seems like it stopped.

title: Geamana
textContent: The next video shows a story of 'Geamana' village that raise awareness for the consequences of open pit mining. That was a reason why we had the streets protests against the new gold exploitation which should open in Rosia Montana in 2014. So the project was closed and Rosia saved for now, but for 'Geamana' is to late. During communism the villagers were moved away and the waste from the 'Rosia Poieni' exploitation was thrown all over the village. Now only the tower of the village church can be seen here in the middle of 'hell'.
